properties.caption: A series of Moai-inspired masks. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"It’s a Match 2.0": paste-up by Paloma Rodríguez. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"#Resign Piñera": paste-up by Caiozzama. © Eric Zolov.
"Do Not Forgive Them for They Know Exactly What They Are Doing": paste-up by Caiozzama. © Eric Zolov.
"He Likes Gasoline" : paste-up by Caoizzama in the Lastarria neighborhood. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"We are Latin American Rockers": paste-up of Gabriela Mistral by Fab Ciraolo. © Eric Zolov.
Paste-up by Fab Ciraolo of "Superman" with the face of beloved television host Felipe Camiroaga. © Eric Zolov.
Paste-up by Fab Ciraolo playing on "Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
First Lady Cecilia Morel portrayed by Fab Ciraolo as "Agent M" from "Men in Black." © Eric Zolov.
Graphic employing a Lichtenstein-like explosion. © Eric Zolov.
Elaborate mural with Zombie-like cops along Ramón Carnicer Street. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
Protestors reminiscent of Keith Haring figures. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
Stencil referencing First Lady Cecilia Morel’s off-the-record comment about an "alien invasion." © Eric Zolov.
Stencil riffing on the alien theme. © Eric Zolov.
"Aliens take power": minimalistic graphic on the Avenida Providencia. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"We’ve come for Human Rights": a sign in the Plaza Ñuñoa. © Eric Zolov.
"It’s a Match": paste-up by Paloma Rodríguez at GAM. © Eric Zolov.
